column5: Well last Sunday I removed my hut and had no intentions of going fishing...but the weather was soooooo nice I couldn't resist.  So on the way back we headed out to one of the eastern tributaries to try and find some open water.  Most of the river was still frozen but we found one small stretch and landed this 30.5" steelie....weighing in at 11.5 lbs. on a green roe bag.  I hate to kill fish, but I am out of roe so this big hen had mature eggs that should last for the rest of the year.I sent to copy to our captain.  Jason
What a beauty, congrats.  That'll be nice and tasty too.  Joey
is that fish already cleaned gutted? from the grocery store? lol jk good job! nice fish.... (jealous)
WHOA! Nice steelie...and a hen to boot!  Great job and nice looking fish!
Congrats!  A nice fish and you got your team on the board   bly
Sweet !!! Go team 7 !!!!  And now that we got some decent inches .... I can fish for some smaller ones (for the pan  )
Great stuff and I get to add an in-land Trout to our team when Peter gets things set up!
